name: lib/messages/mconnectto.js
MConnectTo
description:
Message that requires from-peer to initiate a WebRTC connection with to
to-peer.

params.name: from
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that should initiate the
WebRTC connection.

params.name: to
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that should accept the
WebRTC connection.

name: lib/messages/mdirect.js
MDirect
description:
Messages traveling between two direct neighbors. It requests from the
receiving peer that it initiates a connection with the emitter.

name: lib/messages/mforwarded.js
MForwarded
description:
Message piggybacking another message that has been forwarded by an
intermediate peer.

params.name: from
params.description: The departure of the piggybacked message.

params.name: to
params.description: The arrival of the piggybacked message.

params.name: message
params.description: The piggybacked message to deliver.

name: lib/messages/mforwardto.js
MForwardTo
description: Message that asks a peer to forward the piggybacked message to to-peer.

params.name: from
params.description: The departure of the message.

params.name: to
params.description: The arrival of the piggybacked message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to piggyback.

name: lib/n2n-overlay.js
N2N
description:
A peer has an inview and an outview, i.e., tables containing sockets to
communicate with remote peers. This module transforms a peer so it can act as
a bridge between its direct neighbors. Consequently, these neighbors can
create their own communication channels: necessary data to establish the
connection travel through the bridge; once the connection is successfully
established, they communicate using their own direct connection.

params.name: options
params.description:
options represented as an object (refer to
neighborhood-wrtc for other options).

params.name: options.pid
params.description: The unique identifier of the protocol.

params.name: options.retry
params.description:
The number of times it tries to send
a message.

params.name: options.inview
params.description:
The neighborhood used for inviews,
i.e., incoming arcs.

params.name: options.outview
params.description:
The neigbhorhood used for
outviews, i.e., outgoing arcs.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that we received a
message from.

params.name: message
params.description: The message received.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that we received a
message from.

params.name: stream
params.description: The stream received.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the
newly added arc.

params.name: isOutgoing
params.description: State if the added arc is outgoing or not.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that removed an arc.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer we failed to establish
a connection with.

params.name: isOutgoing
params.description:
State whether or not the failed arc was
supposed to be an outgoing arc.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that sent us the
message

params.name: msg
params.description: The message received.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that we received a
message from.

params.name: message
params.description: The received message.

name: send
description: Send a message using either the inview or the outview.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the receiver.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to send.

params.name: retry
params.description:
Number of times it retries to send a
message.

return.description:
Promise that resolves if the message is sent, reject
otherwise.

name: connect
description:
Create an arc (establishes a WebRTC connection if need be) from 'from' to
'to'. (TODO) explain function args

params.name: from
params.description:
The identifier of the peer
that must initiate the connection. Null implicitely means this.

params.name: to
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that must
accept the connection. Null implicitely means this.

name: disconnect
description: Remove an arc of the outview or all arcs

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the arc to remove.

content:
# n2n-overlay-wrtc [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/RAN3D/n2n-overlay-wrtc.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/RAN3D/n2n-overlay-wrtc) This project aims to ease the creation of overlay networks on top of WebRTC. Additional WebRTC-specific constraints make such projects more difficult than they should be. For instance, establishing a connection requires a round-trip of "offers". Such messages usually transit a dedicated signaling server. The peers of this project still require a signaling server for their entrance in the network. Afterwards, peers become signaling servers too, i.e., they mediate connections between their direct neighbors. This module divides the entering arcs (inview) from the outgoing arcs (outview). The way connections are handled are left to the discretion of overlay protocols built on top of this module. A peer with two neighbors can ask to one of them to connect to the other. Several overlay network protocols use neighbor-to-neighbor interactions to converge to a topology exposing the desired properties. ## Principle

There exists a network comprising at least Peer ```:|```. Peer ```:]``` wants to join this network. ```:|``` knows it and opens an access to the network thanks to a signaling server. The signaling server is in charge of transmitting the necessary WebRTC data from both sides. The figure shows this protocol with the 1->2->3->4 steps that can be repeated many times depending on network configurations. If the protocol is successful, it creates a direct browser-to-browser connection from ```:]``` to ```:|```.

Peers already in the network do not need to use a signaling server to establish connections, for each of them can act as a signaling server, i.e. as a bridge from a neighbor to another. In the figure, ```:3```, ```:]```, and ```:|``` are in the network. ```:3``` can establish a WebRTC connection to ```:|``` using ```:]```. Such neighbor-to-neighbor connections are common in distributed peer-sampling protocols. ## Installation ```$ npm install n2n-overlay-wrtc``` ## API The API is avalaible [here](https://ran3d.github.io/n2n-overlay-wrtc/) ## Example A live example is available [here](https://ran3d.github.io/n2n-overlay-wrtc/example/browser.html). The module [spray-wrtc](https://github.com/ran3d/spray-wrtc) extends n2n-overlay-wrtc to implement a random peer-sampling protocol.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
    "name": "n2n-overlay-wrtc",
    "version": "2.0.8",
    "description": "A WebRTC peer is able to mediate the connection establishment between its neighbors, i.e., it becomes a signaling server for its neighbors. It allows peers to organize their overlay network.",
    "main": "lib/n2n-overlay.js",
    "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "https://github.com/ran3d/n2n-overlay-wrtc"
    },
    "keywords": [
        "WebRTC",
        "browser-to-browser communication",
        "overlay network",
        "distributed signaling server"
    ],
    "author": "Chat-Wane",
    "license": "MIT",
    "dependencies": {
        "debug": "^3.1.0",
        "lodash": "^4.17.5",
        "neighborhood-wrtc": "^2.0.6",
        "uuid": "^3.2.1"
    },
    "bundledDependencies": [
        "neighborhood-wrtc",
        "lodash",
        "uuid",
        "debug"
    ],
    "devDependencies": {
        "babel-core": "^6.26.0",
        "babel-preset-env": "^1.6.1",
        "babelify": "^8.0.0",
        "browserify": "^16.1.1",
        "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
        "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "esdoc-node": "^1.0.3",
        "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0"
    },
    "scripts": {
        "esdoc": "esdoc && npm run esdoc:example",
        "esdoc:example": "cp -R ./build ./example ./img ./docs",
        "test": "npm run all",
        "all": "npm run debug && npm run build && npm run esdoc",
        "debug": "browserify -r ./lib/n2n-overlay.js:n2n-overlay-wrtc -t [ babelify --presets [ env ] ] --debug > build/n2n-overlay-wrtc.bundle.debug.js",
        "build": "browserify -r ./lib/n2n-overlay.js:n2n-overlay-wrtc -t [ babelify --presets [ env ] ] > build/n2n-overlay-wrtc.bundle.js"
    }
}
name: package.json
